import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.9fd19308:
**Premise**

The year is 1913, and you are in the insurance business in Southampton, United Kingdom. There you are, doing the business of insurance, insuring, if you will. And in walks J.P. Morgan. J.P. says hi, and, since he's a busy guy, he gets right to the point. 

His company, the Oceanic Steam Navigation Company, recently had something of a setback, by which he means that the Titanic sank and a bunch of people died and now the survivors are suing his company for a lot of money. He's confident that he won't have to pay out very much, but just in case something like this happens again, he is interested in alternate arrangements that would enable passengers on his ships to purchase what would basically amount to dual life-travel insurance. He's especially interested in providing these insurance options to the passengers aboard Titanic's sister ships, the HMS Olympic and the HMS Britannic.
